definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Tom is a short fuse, he has bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆是個急性子，脾氣不好。

sentences.english: The short-tempered bird flew away to the sky.
A typical quick temper, and work is rash, almost not pass through the brain.
sentences.chinese: 一個典型的急性子，做事也很魯莽，幾乎不經過大腦。

sentences.english: He had always been a "doer, " and his eagerness was often taken as arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 由於事必躬親，他的急性子常被視爲是一種傲慢。

sentences.english: Now he was in heady company.
sentences.chinese: 現在，賈爾周圍都是急性子的人。

sentences.english: That, I think, and his quick temper and relevant.
sentences.chinese: 我想，這和自己的急性子也有關。

sentences.english: He is a short fuse indeed.
Sunny's worst fault is her quick temper.
sentences.chinese: 桑妮最大的毛病是她的急性子。

sentences.english: Indeed he has a short   temper.
Watch out for his hot temper .

definition: to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
frank and outspoken (idiom)/straight speaking/to say what one thinks
(dialect) to dawdle/to waste time/also written 墨跡|墨迹[mo4 ji5]
lit. closed gourd/fig. enigma/complete mystery/taciturn person
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
